Key: Okay, let's line up for the roller coaster.

The line is so long. I suppose this means it
is a popular ride?

Yeah, I guess so. Roller coasters are almost
always popular.
Ooh. I'm excited!
My heart... is thumping.
Are you okay, Yoshino? It's really tall,\nand really fast.
You okay, Yoshino?
Yes... I am fine.

Still, the line goes on forever. I can't even
tell where the end is. How long are we gonna
have to wait?

Shido, over there. There's a sign pointing to the
end of the line.

Confirmation. It is an estimated sixty minutes
from the end of the line to the front.

Oh, thanks you two. I see. Sixty minutes, huh?
Wait, isn't than an hour wait?!
Surprise. You could view an entire short film.

What should we do, Onii-chan? Should we give
it up for today?

No, we're here and everything. If we can't
wait an hour, what can we do!
Yeeeeah!

For now, let's get in line. It'll be a long wait,
so brace yourselves for the challenge, everyone.
Still, waiting in line is such a bore.

(Looking around, I see people poking at their
phones or pulling out game consoles. One hour
is no joke.)

(They say that couples should avoid amusement
parks typically because of the painful waits.)

Hey, Maria. What are you up to? Find
anything interesting?

Human observation... Is that what you would call
it?
Human observation?

Yes. Age, gender, numbers within a group.
It is extremely interesting to observe all of
their behaviors.
Oh, I see. I see what you mean.

Each and every person who comes to this
park comes from a different walk of life.

Even the ways parents interact with their
children vary. The notion entertains me.

(It's crazy to think everyone besides us is
an NPC.)

The group over there have been drawing
sticks.

Oh. They're deciding the order of who should
sit where on the roller coaster. That way, you
can sit by someone you're interested in.

The family over there appears to be peering
into something.

It looks like a digital camera. They might be
checking out the pictures they've taken. It
seems everyone is making the most of waiting.
Yes. How intriguing.
Maybe I'll look around a bit more too.

(I was thinking about how bored I was
earlier, but if I'm waiting, I might as well
enjoy myself.)
Return. Apologies, Shido. I am back.
Huh? When did you leave...?

We left the line momentarily to purchase
some refreshments.

Supply. An hour is long after all. I anticipated
us to go hungry.
I see. Thanks, you two.
They're done, Onii-chan!

Oooh. I noticed you were quiet. What have
you been up to?

Heh heh heh. We heard what you two were
talking about, so Yoshino and I tried making
sticks. Now we can choose how to pair up.
I-I think we made them well...
Oh, then let's try using them.

It's no problem. Even if I leave it to chance,
I will be the one to sit beside Shido. It is
decided.

Challenge. It will not go that way, Lady
Origami. I am the one in control of the fate.
I-I won't lose either...!
Best of luck, Yoshino! Yeeeeah!
Ah ha ha. Do your best, everyone!

Wait, Kotori. You just hid something, didn't
you? Show it to me.
Eeep. I didn't hide anything, Onii-chan.

It's obvious you're holding something in
your left hand... Hey, that's the longest stick.
What an obvious trick.

Th-This is, um... You know, just in case we
lose a stick...

Kotori, since you went through the trouble
of crafting the sticks, perhaps it is best
for them to be used fairly.
Hm. You're right. I'm sorry.
Okay. Everyone pull one.

Confirmation. Then, if everyone approves,
I will give the signal on two. One, two!
Excuse me, how about counting to six?
Okay. Right this way. Have a great time!
(Well, the order we ended up in was...)

It was the fate of the sticks. It cannot be
helped.

Sigh. Lady Origami, it is already over. Try
to enjoy yourself regardless.
All right, then.
W-Well, guess that's how it goes.
Um, Kotori... We can still have fun.

(All of a sudden, Kotori was wearing her
black ribbons. Is she scared of the ride?
She loves acting tough, so it's possible.)
Shido, that is where we go, yes?
Yup. That's right.
I feel slightly nervous for some reason.

It'll be fine. It's the two of us again, huh
Maria?

Yes. It is a shame that I am not sitting
beside you, Shido. It would be more fun
that way.
S-Sure... Thanks.

(This roller coaster has a unique design,
with one person sitting in front, and three
in the back. I got the frontmost seat.

(We took our seats, and the ride began to
accelerate slowly.)

This coaster. Is it not moving slower than
how it looked in line?

Roller coasters don't start at that speed.
Um. It'd be better for you to experience it
than for me to explain. Here. It'll speed up.
Understood. So it increases in speed over time.

I mean, not exactly. All right, Maria.
You ready?
Ready?
Yup, that's right. We're about to go down!
Go down...? What do you mean by—

(Maria was interrupted as the cart dropped
down the steep slope. We traveled at high
speed, as if we were flung into the air.)
(But are the drops normally this long?!)
(This is surprisingly intense!)
O-Ooogh...
K-Kotori-san...
We are going several G's in speed...

Agreement. If I open my mouth too much,
I may bite my tongue.
(Everyone seems to be doing okay.)
Should I let out a scream at this time?
Yeah...
Then, kyaaaaaaa!!
Kyaaaaaaaaa!!
M-Maria!

(Maria's exhilarating yell released all of the
tension in my body. Okay, my turn!)
Whooooooah!!!
This is so exciting!
Yeah!
Kyaaaaaah!!
IYAAAAAH!
A-AAAAH! Hyaaaa!
...! Kyaa.
Kyaaaaaaa!
Aaaaaaaaahh!!

(I realized soon that everyone was screaming,
though I couldn't tell if it was from fear or
joy.)

(The thrill comes from the rise and fall of
the cart. No wonder people are so addicted
to roller coasters.)

(Man, my legs feel so wobbly. It might be my
imagination, but it seems like my back is giving
out too. Maybe that first drop WAS too long.)
Hee hee. It was fun, wasn't it?

Yeah, sure was. Haven't had a rush like that
in a while.

(For someone having just survived that screaming
metal death trap, I can't stop smiling. As if my
face is stretched out. Is it the excitement?)

It was a lovely experience. A place where I
can scream without reservation. Different
than karaoke. It was entirely new to me.
Yeah, you're right.

(Once we got off the ride, Kotori had
changed into her white ribbons. Busy
girl.)

(Once we got off the ride, Kotori had
changed into her white ribbons. Busy
girl.)
What do you mean, Kotori?
I mean, that. Over there.
Oh, right. The photo.
They snap the photo while you're riding\nthe coaster, all secret-like!
Err. I wouldn't put it like that...
I see. I am curious.
All right. Then let's take a look.
Yes!
Haha. Our faces are totally stretched out.
Yes, it is a wonderful picture.

Totally. You seem to be having fun, Maria.
Want to buy this as a souvenir?
Is that okay?
Yes, of course.
Then, please purchase one for me too.

Petition. Shido, I wish to procure one as well.
A souvenir of today would be exquisite.
Sh-Shido-san, me too..
Don't forget Yoshino and me, okay, Shido-kun?

All right. Got it. You're fine with mine,
right, Kotori? I'll buy five.
Here, Maria. Don't lose it, okay?
...Yes. I will take good care of it.
Okay.

(The wait for the roller coaster was long,
but I'm glad Maria had a good time. I'm
sure this photo will be a nice memento.)

It would've been great to get a copy for
myself.
...Did you say something, Shido?

No, nothing. Want to take a break, or do
you want to see another attraction?

This attraction took up a lot of our time,
so why don't we see another?
Yeah. You're right.

(And so, we saw the rest of the park long
until after the sun had set.)
